title: See how Anfield as changed through the years following Liverpool's latest redevelopment work
text:
See how Anfield as changed through the years following Liverpool's latest redevelopment work The Main Stand underwent a huge transformation last season with work being completed in the summer Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Get daily   
The sheer scale of the redevelopment of Liverpool's Main Stand at Anfield can been seen in these stunning aerial pictures. 
From the air, you can see how the new stand towers above the rest of the ground, as thousands of extra fans have been accommodated this season, report the Liverpool Echo . 
This is just the latest in a series of changes to one of English football's most famous stadiums, which has seen the ground reshaped in recent years. 
Over the course of around 50 years, Anfield has expanded to hold 54,074 football fans and 64 executive suites. Redevelopment work occurred last season and was completed in the summer (Photo: Peter Byrne/PA Wire) The new Main Stand in all its glory (Photo: Barrington Coombs) 
The Main Stand development came after years of uncertainty, with the club considering leaving Anfield for a new home. Instead, plans to expand and redevelop their current home ground were adopted and renovations began in January 2015. 
The expanded Main Stand is now made up of three tiers and provides new team benches, wheelchair viewing positions, new fan facilities and a wider player tunnel. poll loading Is Anfield your favourite Premier League ground? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
